thread.title: Ordsall Chord: Manchester rail link bridge lifted into place
thread.title_full: Ordsall Chord: Manchester rail link bridge lifted into place

title: Ordsall Chord: Manchester rail link bridge lifted into place
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Ordsall Chord: Manchester rail link bridge lifted into place 21 February 2017 Last updated at 19:44 GMT 
Two giant railway arches have been lifted into place linking Manchester's Victoria and Piccadilly stations as part of the Ordsall Chord scheme. 
The 600-tonne structure was lifted into place across the River Irwell using one of the largest cranes in Europe on Tuesday. 
The scheme is part of the multi-million pound Northern Hub upgrade for rail services across the North of England. Read more
